result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution is set at $1,400.00 payable to Mark M.
*05-25-17 Court granted four additional years to pay restitution after the completion of probation.
*Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and restitution by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
      *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Restitution is set at $1,400.00 payable to Mark M.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and resititution by
          the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending next court hearing.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice point discharge report received and filed.
Justice Point report dated 4-18-2016, received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court.  Defencant NOT in court. Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case was set for Calendar call due to defendant non appearance on 4-14-2016. Defendant fails to appear for today's hearing. Court lifts  the Stay and issues  the Bench Warrant. Court orders signature bond to be forfeited.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court.  Defendant NOT in court. Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case was set for sentencing hearing today. Defendant failing to appear. Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued and Stayed until the next  court hearing.  Calendar call scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Justice point report received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No file in court. Violation report received and filed. Court admonished defendant but did not change the bail.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Michael Maurice Schiessl not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/6/15 @ 1 PM
